title.narrative: Bidrag til International Women's Health Coalition (IWHC)

description.narrative:
The IWHC has successfully mobilised activists and opinion leaders and has supported the UN and other international organizations working with SRHR. IWHC cooperates with UN organizations, governments and private funds to ensure that policy, programmes and technical guidelines incorporate SRHR. Finally, the organization delivers strategic communication, which informs and affects opinion leaders and decision makers in the field of SRHR. IWHC has trained and taught advocacy workers in 42 countries and has conducted its own advocacy work e.g. in connection with sessions at the Commission on the Status of Women (CSW) and the post-2015 agenda.
Regionally the IWHC has supported and conducted capacity building of local partner organisations e.g. in five African countries: Botswana, Nigeria, South Africa, Swaziland and Cameroun. The focus areas are mentoring and supporting young female leaders and activists in the Global South with the purpose of enabling them to be advocate for SRHR as well as capacity building of organizations that work with the rights of women and youth. For example in Nigeria, IWHC supported and helped the national partner organization to reach the most vulnerable groups of society such as young people, sexual minorities, sex workers and widows, which lives with hiv/aids with education and advocacy work. IWHC has also supported the Girls Power Initiative, which has reached more than 20.000 young women between 10 and 18 years and informed them of their rights, bodies and commitments.

sector.narrative: Women's rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

description.narrative: FL §06.36.03.15 HIV/AIDS and Other Population Programmes
